characters.name: Bart Cassidy
characters.description: Each time he loses an HP, he immediately draws a card from the deck.

characters.name: El Gringo
characters.description: Each time he loses an HP due to a card played by another player, he draws a card at random from that player’s hand (one for each lost HP). If that player has no cards in hand - too bad! - he draws nothing.

characters.name: Jourdonnais
characters.description: He always has a Barrel in play; he can “draw!” when targeted by a BANG!, and with Hearts, it’s a Missed! A real Barrel in play adds to his natural ability, allowing him to try twice to avoid the shot.

characters.name: Paul Regret
characters.description: He always has a Mustang in play; others see him at a distance increased by 1. A real Mustang in play adds to his natural ability, increasing the total distance by 2.

characters.name: Rose Doolan
characters.description: She always has a Scope in play; she sees others at a distance decreased by 1. A real Scope in play adds to her natural ability, decreasing the total distance by 2.

characters.name: Sid Ketchum
characters.description: At any time, he can discard 2 cards from his hand to regain 1 HP. If he wants to and can, he may use this ability multiple times in a row. Remember, you can never have more HP than your initial amount.

characters.name: Suzy Lafayette
characters.description: As soon as she has no cards in hand, she immediately draws a card from the deck.

cards.name: BANG!
cards.description:
The BANG! card is the primary way to take an HP from a player. If you want to play a BANG! card, you must check:
1. the distance to that player; and
2. if your weapon reaches at least that firing distance.

cards.name: Barrel
Beer
cards.description:
This card lets you regain 1 HP. You can never have more HP than you started with! You cannot play Beer to regain HP for another player.
You can play Beer in two ways:
1. normally, during your turn;
2. out of turn, but only if you have just received a fatal shot, i.e., a shot that would take your last HP (and not if you are simply wounded).
Beer has no effect if there are only 2 players left in the game; in other words, if you play Beer, you do not regain any HP.

cards.name: Cat Balou
cards.description: This card makes any player discard one card, regardless of the distance.

cards.name: Stagecoach
cards.description: This card allows you to draw 2 cards from the top of the deck.

cards.name: Gatling
cards.description: The Gatling fires a BANG! at all other players, regardless of distance. Even though the Gatling causes a BANG! to all others, it is not a BANG! card. On your turn, you can play as many Gatling as you want, but always only one BANG! card.

cards.name: Missed!
cards.description: When you are hit by a BANG!, you can immediately play a Missed! (even out of your turn) to cancel the shot; if you don't, you lose 1 HP. When you run out of HP, you are eliminated from the game (unless you immediately play a Beer). You can only cancel BANG! directed at you, not those directed at others. The BANG! card is discarded even if canceled.

cards.name: Scope
cards.description: When you have a Scope in play, you see other players at a distance decreased by 1. Others still see you at the normal distance. Distances less than 1 are considered to be 1.

cards.name: Mustang
cards.description: When you have a Mustang in play, others see you at a distance increased by 1. You still see others at the normal distance.

cards.name: Panic!
cards.description: This card allows you to draw a card from a player at a distance of 1. Remember that this distance is not modified by weapons, only by cards like Mustang and/or Scope.

cards.name: Saloon
cards.description: This card is a powered-up Beer, as its overall effect is that all players in the game regain 1 HP. You cannot play Saloon out of turn when you are about to lose your last HP: Saloon is not Beer!

cards.name: Wells Fargo
cards.description: This card allows you to draw 3 cards from the top of the deck.
